name: Habitabat Ad Mortem
description:
Working, watching TV, sleeping; working, watching TV, sleeping, ... 

If your life is a pattern, things will start to drift more quickly, continually accelerating and you won't notice how life is passing you.  There isn't an end of level display, any extra lives or a chance to start again.  Sometimes we need a wake up call, the change in the pattern to allow us to look around and start to realise that if we don't take any actions to alter our patterns then it will be over before you know it with no chance to go back.

Habitabat Ad Mortem is a depiction of a how easily a life can go unlived and hopefully allow people to see how easy it is to just let life go on around you unless you take an action to inspire change and reset the acceleration of your day-to-day life.

It will show how the mortgage keeps adding up while you are sleeping, the affect of interest rates and interest only loans, showing how much you can end up paying back or leaving behind as debt.  How an unhealthy diet and lack of exercise can affect blood sugar and the affect of aspirations for promotion and new jobs on blood pressure.  You will be affected by age and previous jobs and promotions as career opportunities are sought or left behind.

The game depicts a life where the number of days you have left is known; how would you live yours?
